STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ELIZABETH HERTEL
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
July 25, 2022
Kathleen Sperling
Arenac County DHHS
3709 Deep River Road
Standish, MI 48658
RE: License #: CP060200953
Arenac County DHHS
3709 Deep River Road
Standish, MI 48658
Dear Ms. Sperling:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 07/21/2022.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Exit Plan (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective
action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also
violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days
from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (866) 685-0006.
Sincerely,
Mark R. Hunter, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(989) 395-2847
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of
the following information:
(d) Dates and places of contacts, names of persons
interviewed, and names of the interviewers. If children are
interviewed, their last names shall not be included in the
report.
One of the three special evaluation reports reviewed included the last name of
children placed in the home who was interviewed as a part of the special evaluation.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
worker that has children placed in the home.
One of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation the
social services worker, with children placed in the home, was provided a copy of the
completed special evaluation report. The report indicated the social service worker
was notified that a special evaluation was initiated, but there was no indication the
worker was provided a copy of the completed report with recommendations.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
FOM 722-6B Following the FTM, the caseworker is responsible for the
following:
4

 Completing the DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting
Report, checking it for accuracy, identifying areas
needing follow-up, and recording the outcome data.
 Providing the DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting
Report, to all participants (in person and by phone),
legal parents, and casework supervisor. These
documents must also be uploaded into MISACWIS.
The caseworker must enter the FTM information in
MiSACWIS using the FTM hyperlink within seven
business days of the FTM.
Two of the three current foster child records reviewed each contained one Family Team
Meeting (FTM) that was documented as being completed but did not include
documentation of the FTM as required by this policy. The first example indicated an
FTM on 07/09/2021 that did not include this documentation. The second example
indicated an FTM on 12/27/2021 that did not include this documentation.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
None needed.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
None needed.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation completed
04/15/2021. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that evaluation were
328(2)(e), 510(1)(d), ISEP 6.23, FOM 722-06H, and FOM 722-16. The corrective
action plan was approved 05/06/2021 and none of these areas were identified as
repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim evaluation.
Trends and Repeat Violation Assessment
None of the noncompliance areas identified in the renewal evaluation were identified
as repeat violations as a part of this interim evaluation.
Chief Administrator Assessment
5

The Chief Administrator Assessment included a review of the corrective action plan
to address areas of noncompliance identified in the renewal evaluation and the
ongoing activities associated with the monitoring of the corrective action plan.
Interviews
Child welfare staff were able to participate in entrance and exit interviews. Both
foster care and certification staff participated, and no areas of concern were noted.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
07/22/2022
________________________________________
Mark R. Hunter Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
07/25/2022
________________________________________
Kari Muntean Date
Area Manager
